Time zone used for local time calculations, such as TOU and midnight kWh reads.
Front panel LCD configuration for the MCT-420.
The number of seconds the LCD displays an item before cycling.
The number of kWh digits displayed on the LCD panel.
When true, enable the meter's disconnect display.
Items displayed on the front panel LCD of the MCT-420.
DST and time sync configuration for the MCT-440.
When true, the device recognizes DST. Else, DST changes will be ignored (flag set to 0).
Adjust real time clock when the incoming time sync differs by this many seconds.
Addressing levels used for the MCT-440.
The phase loss settings for triggering an event for the MCT-440.
The time of use schedules used for the MCT-440.
Behaviors used while communicating with DNP devices
The number of retries the DNP Application Layer will attempt before reporting an error out to the device. Default: 2.
Enable to have Yukon interpret and send times as local instead of UTC. Default: false.
Enable to turn on DNP timesyncs. Default: false.
Enable to allow DNP scans to omit time request. Default: false.
Enable to allow sending of unsolicited messages following a device restart. Default: true.
General demand and load profile settings for the MCT-470.
Interval in minutes over which most recent demand is calculated
Interval in minutes over which load profile values are kept.
Profile channel settings of the MCT-470.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 1

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 2

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 3

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 4

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
DST and time sync configuration for the MCT-470.
When true, the device recognizes DST. Else, DST changes will be ignored (flag set to 0).
Adjust real time clock when the incoming time sync differs by this many seconds.
Addressing information for the MCT-430 and MCT-470.
Relay timer settings for the MCT-470.
Time the relay will remain closed in 250ms increments.
Time the relay will remain closed in 250ms increments.
The table number and read intervals that the MCT-470 uses to scan any attached IED.
Seconds between each read of the attached IED. In 15 second increments.
Table to use. Use caution when changing.
MCT-470 Time of Use - KYZ Inputs
The time of use schedules the MCT-470 will apply to any data collected through its KYZ inputs.
Load profile settings for the individual channels of the MCT-430.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 1

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 2

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 3

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 4

The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470’s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.
Resolution power for last interval demand.
DST and time sync configuration for the MCT-430.
If this is set, the device will action any DST changes. Clearing this will force the DST Active flag to zero.
Update the RTC if it is this far away from the incoming time sync
The table number and read intervals that the MCT-430 uses to scan any attached IED.
Seconds between each read of the attached IED. In 15 second increments.
Table to use. Use caution when changing.
Configuration parameters for the load-limiting disconnect feature of MCT and RFN devices.
Demand threshold at which a disconnect will be triggered.
The number of minutes to delay before arming the disconnect for a reconnect.
When a cycling disconnect command is issued to the attached disconnect device, this is the number of minutes that will be from the disconnected part of the cycle.
When a cycling disconnect command is issued to the attached disconnect device, this is the number of minutes that will be from the connected part of the cycle.
When true, the button must be pressed to complete a reconnect to the meter. Else, the reconnect is automatically completed.
